topic: How to profile event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to profile event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Profiling Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to measure and analyze the performance of event-driven applications built with FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the importance of profiling event-driven systems for identifying bottlenecks and optimizing performance
Leverage the power of FastAPI, the high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+
Utilize built-in tools such as uvicorn's profiling capabilities to analyze application performance
Implement custom profiling middleware for even more granular insights into your event-driven system
Explore third-party libraries like aioprofile and cProfile for comprehensive profiling of asynchronous code

code_examples.code:
import cProfile
import pstats
pr = pstats.Profile()
# Run your code here
pr.print_stats(sort=pstats.SortKey.TIME)

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial
caveats: Profiling may impact the performance of your application, so use it judiciously
Custom profiling middleware might require additional setup and understanding of the FastAPI internals
Third-party libraries like aioprofile have certain limitations in terms of compatibility with some libraries and Python versions
